oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-01-09 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 9, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performer Jimmy Driftwood, and regular performers Archie Campbell, the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1057th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Reeves; Archie Campbell; Jimmy Driftwood; Jordanaires; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- In A Mansion Stands My Love (Jim Reeves) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) --Jim Reeves introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Jim Reeves) -- Grant Turner and Jim Reeves introduce Jimmy Driftwood -- The Battle Of New Orleans (Jimmy Driftwood, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Tommy Jackson -- Fisher's Hornpipe (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Jim Reeves talks -- How Long Has It Been (Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Chet Atkins -- One Mint Julep (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Jordanaires (Musical group); Atkins, Chet; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Reeves, Jim; Driftwood, Jimmie; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984
